title: Babinda, Qld: Teen couple Evan Fielder, Lauren Quabba killed in crash
text:
More needs to be done to address the shocking number of deaths on Queensland roads.

A young couple killed in a head-on crash in Far North Queensland had only recently announced their relationship to the world.

Queensland Police said two vehicles collided along the Bruce Highway near Cairns, approximately two kilometres north of Babinda, at 7.30pm on Sunday.

A 19-year-old man from Wongaling Beach and a 16-year-old girl from Bellenden Ker died at the scene.

They have since been identified as Evan Fielder and his girlfriend Lauren Quabba.

“It is believed the two were travelling in the same vehicle,” police said.

The 17-year-old male driver of the second vehicle, from Gulliver, was flown to Cairns Hospital where he remains in a serious condition.

In a public Facebook post on October 4, Mr Fielder announced he was “in a relationship” with Miss Quabba.

“Lauren, you’re family now,” his father and tennis school owner, Wayne Fielder, commented.

The 19-year-old was a semi-professional tennis player and coach with the family’s Baseline Tennis Coaching Academy and had competed this year in tournaments in Cairns, Mareeba, Townsville, Innisfail and Ingham.

Miss Quabba was a student at Babinda P-12 State School.

The Courier Mail reported her parents were “too overwhelmed” to speak publicly of their loss.

The 16-year-old’s cousin, Will Robertson, has paid his respects.

“Rest in Peace my little cousin. I hope to meet with you again sometime,” he said on Facebook.

Luke and Natasha Grimshaw also commented: “We miss you already beautiful girl”.

Logan Skye Owen said her heart was “so incredibly sad” to hear the news this morning.

“I’m blessed to have known you since you were a lil peanut daring me to eat the shaving cream and rotten watermelon on curlys camp,” she wrote on Facebook.

“You’re so very loved Lauren and I’ll miss you dearly.”

Mark Nucifora also shared his condolences.

“Devastated by the news. Such a heartbreaking day for the whole community,” he said in a Facebook post.

“Our thoughts and prayers are with the Quabba family and the family of the teenage boy.”

Police are appealing for witnesses or anyone with further information to come forward.

The Forensic Crash Unit is investigating.
description: A young couple killed in a head-on crash in Far North Queensland had only recently announced their relationship to the world.
